Package com.waddle_ware.heslington_hustle.core

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.waddle_ware.heslington_hustle.core.Core
  • public class Core
extends java.lang.Object
    The Core class represents the core functionality of the game, managing game state, interactions, and scoring.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Core

        public Core()
        Constructs a new Core instance. Initialises energy, time, and activity count arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        This method should be called in the main update loop in order to keep the game state up to date. Currently, the only thing that needs updating is time (to see if enough irl time has passed to decrease the remaining time).

      • interactedWith

        public ResourceExitConditions interactedWith​(ActivityType type)
        This function is the main way for the GUI to interact and manipulate the game state. It should be called whenever a person tries to interact with a building. It will check if the interaction is legal (there is enough energy and time).
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the interaction.
        Returns:
        Resource exit condition. If it is successful, returns (Null, IsOk), else it returns the ResourceType and the type of fault (too high / low).

      • isLastDay

        public boolean isLastDay()
        Checks whether it's the last day of the game.
        Returns:
        true if it's the last day, false otherwise.

      • hasEnded

        public boolean hasEnded()
        Checks whether the game has ended. (Intended to be used to indicate a need to change from the play screen).
        Returns:
        true if the game has ended, false otherwise.

      • incrementDay

        public void incrementDay()
        Changes to the next day. Throws an exception if the maximum number of days is exceeded.

      • hasPlayerFailed

        public boolean hasPlayerFailed()
        Checks whether the player has hit a fail condition Intended to be used after game has ended to determine whether to display a fail or win screen. This should only be called once the game has ended. It will throw an exception if called before.
        Returns:
        true/false based on whether the play has failed

      • generateScore

        public int generateScore​(ActivityLocation[] activityLocations)
        CHANGELOG : UPDATED METHOD CHANGELOG : Method now takes array of activityLocations CHANGELOG : Updated all scoring calculations and return score as a percentage from 0-100 This function generate the player's score based on their tracked metrics and the value of each metric as specified by their respective constants. This should only be called once the game has ended. It will throw an exception if called before.
        Returns:
        The total score that the player has achieved

      • getNumLocationsActivity

        public int getNumLocationsActivity​(ActivityLocation[] activities,
                                   ActivityType type)
        CHANGELOG: NEW METHOD Added in order to complete scoring logic: Takes in an array of activities and an Activity type and returns then number of different locations that type of activity was done at
        Parameters:
        activities - Array of ActivityLocations
        type - Type of activity to check
        Returns:
        Number of different locations the player did that type of activity

      • getNumDaysActivity

        public int getNumDaysActivity​(int[] list)
        CHANGELOG : NEW METHOD Added in order to complete scoring logic: Takes in the activity counter arrays and returns the number of days it was done on
        Parameters:
        list - Array of ActivityLocations
        Returns:
        Number of different days the player did that type of activity

      • checkStreaks

        public boolean[] checkStreaks​(ActivityLocation[] activityLocations)
        CHANGELOG: NEW METHOD This method checks if the user has completed the streak achievements: Athlete for playing football, Bookworm for library, and Clubber for clubbing
        Parameters:
        activityLocations - List of activity location objects
        Returns:
        Boolean array, True/False for each streak completed

      • getCurrentDay

        Returns:
        current day
